item.title: Red Dunes Games announces TGS 2025 lineup, including new games by ACQUIRE
item.content:encoded:
Introducing Monster Eater and Hamrazu:Re.

Red Dunes Games has announced its games lineup for Tokyo Game Show 2025, which will run from September 25 to 28 at Makuhari Messe in Chiba, Japan.

“Returning to [Tokyo Game Show] this year is both exciting and meaningful for us,” said Red Dune Games CEO Sultan Darmakin in a press release. “What began with just a handful of booths last year has grown into one of the largest presences at the show, reflecting the trust of our partners and the passion of our teams. Our lineup highlights the balance we believe in: pairing flagship titles with standout indie games that deserve the spotlight. At Red Dunes, our focus remains the same, supporting both established and emerging creators and delivering experiences that are fun, meaningful, and shared with our partners and fans.”

The Red Dunes Games booth will feature a curated lineup of 12 games playable across 32 high-performance PCs, powered by sponsor GALLERIA. While all playable games will be showcased on PC, console versions are also planned.

The publisher’s games lineup is as follows:

  • Blades of Mirage – A highly epic imaginative isometric RPG set in a Southeast Asian-inspired world. As Mira, use your ability to create water-based weapons and utilize your strongest strategies to defeat the guardians and secure the treasures. Explore ancient ruins scattered across unique islands, confront corrupted, powerful creatures and solve intricate puzzles to secure the ancient relics.
  • Katuba’s Poacher – South Korean one-man developer / studio Joe Yu shows off his exceptional talent. Katuba’s Poacher is a boss-rush cartoon action challenge, with a subtle blend of roguelite, action and ‘arcade boss battles’ elements. You are on a quest to defeat bosses in battles that play out like musical acts, brought to life in a hand-drawn, 2D cartoon fantasy world.
  • LightSup! – A couch action beat ’em up cooperative game for one-to-four players with roguelite elements. Encounter hordes of ferocious monsters crawling from the dungeons and forest. Prepare your weapons, worship the Altar of Lights to illuminate your path, and cleanse the Lumineia Kingdom from the Eclipse and its eternal darkness.
  • Nightmare Circus – Find your friends and escape the nightmare in the award-nominated Nightmare Circus which is an enthralling action-adventure game where you take on the role of a Puppeteer trapped in the Nightmare Realm. Employ an array of tools for creating satisfying collisions to smash, crash, and slam into enemies, obstacles, and danger; create your play style to deal with the many nightmares that roam the land!
  • Port of Jumanah – A 2.5D action-adventure with roguelite elements, Port of Jumanah follows Mansour on a surreal journey beneath the waves. Inspired by the United Arab Emirates’ pearl diving heritage, the game blends fast-paced combat, whimsical storytelling, and a richly imagined underwater world filled with secrets to uncover.
  • Princess of the Water Lilies – A hand-drawn 2D puzzle-platformer where a cat, frogs, and other creatures bring a whimsical world to life. Explore beautifully crafted environments inspired by classic animated tales from the 70s to the 90s.
  • Samurai Pizza Cats: Blast from the Past! – Announced early in the year to wild and enthusiastic feedback. This iconic intellectual property, backed fully by the owners/creators of the original Samurai Pizza Cats TV series! This is one very sought after title! Take control of the Pizza Cats and prevent The Big Cheese from taking over Little Tokyo once and for all in this 2D action-packed adventure.
  • Silent Planet: Elegy of a Dying World – The year is 2997. Steel yourself with your Asimov Plasma Blade and harness the power of the ancient Psionic Disciplines in Silent Planet, an exploration-focused, gothic science-fiction Metroidvania rooted in cosmic horror—a mix of genres seamlessly conjoined to create a game of mature intrigue! You play as Apranik. Your mission is to travel to the planet Thulcandra in search of a crucial item: the Angel’s Egg. Explore the claustrophobic corridors of a massive underground complex filled with the remnants of technological and biological horrors created by a dead civilization.
  • Zozo and the Lost Dreams – A light-hearted 2D Metroidvania platformer about Zozo, a young boy trapped in a dream world. Join Zozo as he explores the bizarre dream world packed with quirky characters, peculiar enemies, funny stories, and surprises that’ll keep you on your toes. With a neat storyline, humorous narratives, and a colourful and vibrant world, this is an indie game with plenty of appeal!

The following three games developed by ACQUIRE will also be featured:

Monster Eater

In a city haunted by urban legends, anomalies lurk in the shadows. To survive, you must hunt them—or be consumed.

Hamrazu:Re

A time loop begins aboard a train bound for destiny. Each rewind uncovers new secrets, but the clock is always ticking.

Codename: Project Tremor

When colossal threats rise, the fight to reclaim everyday life begins.

According to the press release, these projects “mark just the beginning of Red Dunes’ growing partnership with ACQUIRE,” and ACQUIRE will share “further announcements” on September 19.

Watch a sizzle reel for Red Dunes Games’ lineup below.

item.title: Ripple Island remake Ripple Island: Kyle and Cal’s Restaurant announced for Switch 2, PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • Switch 2

Due out on November 27.

SUNSOFT has announced Ripple Island: Kyle and Cal’s Restaurant, a full 3D remake of its 1988-released adventure game Ripple Island. It will launch for Switch 2 and PC via Steam on November 27 for 4,378 yen with English, French, Italian, German, Spanish, Japanese, Korean, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese language support.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

The restaurant is bustling with customers!

Ripple Island: Kyle and Cal’s Restaurant is a cooperative cooking action game for up to 16 players.

Team up with the unique animals of Ripple Island to serve up delicious dishes!

To cook any dish, you first need to gather ingredients.

Grow vegetables, catch fish, collect eggs from your pets… Gather ingredients in all sorts of ways and show off your cooking skills!

Story

Upon an unknown sea floats an unknown island: Ripple Island.

Surrounded by rich nature, the island was blessed with an abundance of fresh, delicious ingredients and was home to many skilled chefs.

Then one day, a question popped into the head of the island’s king, Dotella:

“What is the most delicious dish on this island?”

To find the answer, King Dotella issued a proclamation to all the chefs on the island:

“A cooking tournament will be held to decide the greatest chef on the island! Whoever creates the best dish will be rewarded with a grand treasure!”

This proclamation reached the ears of Kyle, a chef living on the outskirts of the island.

Kyle, who had always dreamed of making it big, immediately got ready and set off for the castle where the tournament would be held.

Key Features

  • Challenge Mode
    • In Challenge Mode, you can play with up to four players in local cooperative play.
    • Work together with your family and friends to beat each stage!
  • Everyone’s Restaurant
    • Enjoy massive cooperative fun with up to 16 players online!
    • Teamwork and dividing tasks are the keys to conquering up to six stages within the time limit!
    • You can also have up to eight local players join an online session together!
    • Jump into online multiplayer and have a blast with your family and friends!
  • Various Ways to Play
    • Solo Play
      • From gathering ingredients to cooking, serving, and cleaning, you’ll do it all by yourself.
      • Aim for victory by making the best decisions while running the entire operation solo!
    • 16-Player Cooperative Play
      • You won’t clear these stages without delegating roles!
      • The key to success is to watch your teammates’ actions and figure out the best way you can contribute.

And now… Let’s get cooking!

Watch the announcement trailer below. Visit the official website here.

item.title: HEART of CROWN Online launches December 18 for Switch, PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • Switch

Currently in Early Access for PC.

HEART of CROWN Online will leave Early Access and launch for Switch and PC via Steam on December 18, publishers PLAYISM and Japanime Games, and developers illuCalab. and FLIPFLOPs announced. The PLAYISM partnership and Switch version are newly announced.

HEART of CROWN Online first launched in Early Access for PC via Steam on April 23, 2004.

In Japan, the Switch version will also be available physically for 5,500 yen. Pre-orders include a set of eight hologram cards.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

The great emperor’s untimely death… Seven princesses are candidates for his succession! Who will save the empire from chaos?

HEART of CROWN Online is a deckbuilding card game based on HEART of CROWN 2nd Edition, which was relaunched in 2022.

System

  • A four-player turn-based game.
  • Use the money you earn from your estates to buy new lands and various action cards to advance your game.
  • Once you have enough resources, you’re ready to recruit the Princess! Every Princess has a powerful effect, but be careful, the early bird gets the worm.
  • Get the senators, dukes, and other influential people on your side, and when your “succession score” reaches 20 points, you will be crowned. The throne is yours.
  • Online cross-play is supported! Ranked matches and free matches are also available.

Story

In a wild time when swords and magic still ruled the world, an empire had united the entire continent and ended a long war. However, before the peace could be solidified, the great emperor fell ill, without a successor in place…

If this continues, we could be back to a war-torn world!

You are one of the most powerful people in the empire. You must quickly establish the emperor’s throne and ensure the unity and peace of the continent. The emperor had no male children, but fortunately, he had seven candidates to succeed him, including two princesses of direct descent.

Now, let’s get the princess of your dreams to ascend to the throne!

item.title: Million Depth demo now available
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Play through one of the game's three routes.

A demo for side-scrolling deep-diving action strategy game Million Depth is now available for PC via Steam, publisher PLAYISM and developer Cyber Space Biotope announced. It features one out of the three routes in the full game in its entirety.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Roguelike x unknown discovery in the depths of a million underground floors.

“Embark on a roguelike journey into the depths of Earth, explore a million underground floors, and uncover the unknown.”

After Earth’s downfall, the protagonist “Moma” aims to explore the depths of a million underground layers. Being attacked by unique creatures and androids from the underground, Moma fights back using weapons she crafts along the way. Sometimes, the stunning views of the underground world steal her heart as she uncovers the mystery behind the downfall of underground humanity and the truth about “YOU.” Her quest for answers drives her to continue exploring the depths.

Crafting and Battle

  • A Crafting System Where Your Drawings Transform into Weapons – To survive the harsh underground environment, you must craft weapons and armor depending on the circumstances. You can create your own weapons and armor by combining various parts. It’s up to you to decide whether to make them more powerful for attacking, easier to defend against enemy assaults, enhance mobility for quick movement, or go for a stylish look – it’s all up to your imagination!
  • Combat System Where the World Stops When You Stop – By using the “Biotope Jammer” brought from space, Moma can freeze all movement around her while she remains still. It is essential to think carefully and adapt according to the situation.
  • Unique Battles – In these battles, you can see the enemy’s attack power, and you can reduce their power by hitting them with your crafted weapons. However, when your crafted weapon hits the enemy, it starts to crumble. Once it surpasses a certain threshold, it enters an automatic recovery mode and becomes temporarily unusable. This leads to strategic battles where you have to figure out how to preserve your own weapons while dealing damage to the enemy.

Unique Storytelling Through Parallel Worlds

  • A Story that Changes with Every Replay – This game employs a “multi-ending” structure, branching based on encountered levels and specific conditions. Moreover, these endings can influence the next player’s gameplay (the past “Moma” in parallel worlds). With each playthrough, you’ll notice changes in the same NPCs (the androids) as well. With various parallel worlds, you can repeatedly enjoy the evolving story. Discover the ending that Moma desires the most!
  • Discovery of the Unknown – In the underground, you’ll find numerous floors that make you wonder, “Why would something like this be underground?!” While enjoying short stories from those floors and learning about past humanity, players gradually piece together the puzzle of what befell past mankind. However, is that understanding truly accurate? Delve into the joy of unraveling a complex story woven across multiple parallel worlds!

Million Depth is due out for PC via Steam on November 12.

item.title: DYPING: ESCAPE to be published by PLAYISM
item.content:encoded:
PLAYISM will publish Heaviside Creations-developed horror typing game DYPING: ESCAPE when it launches for PC via Steam, the companies announced. A release date was not announced, but the game was originally planned for release this summer.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

I want you to play this typing game.

Just type the keys as instructed.

There’s no need to think at all.

Key Features

  • A Cursed Typing Game – The ominous “Eye” presents you with malicious typing prompts. The words you type become reality and come back to haunt you. “Please kill me.” If you type this sentence, you die. Game over.
  • Breaking the Game from the Outside – The game is filled with unavoidable, unfair deaths. Once the sinister text appears, it seems like your only choice is to type it and march toward your demise… But perhaps, you can still open the settings menu.
  • Roguelike Typing – As you progress, the “Eye” forces ever-growing hardships upon you. However, by obtaining Fragments—pieces that allow you to alter words and letters—you might just find a way to fight back.

item.title: Mind Diver launches September 28
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Murder mystery adventure game dated.

Murder mystery adventure game Mind Diver will launch for PC via Steam on September 28, publisher PLAYISM and developer Indoor Sunglasses announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Investigate a broken mind to unravel a twisted case. Deduce the truth. Restore lost memories. Listen to private conversations. Draw your own conclusions. Mind Diver is a murder mystery, where the victim is love.

Explore the Mind Ocean to Solve a Twisted Case

You are a Mind Diver.

Using experimental technology, you explore Lina’s Mind Ocean, fixing her memories to solve an unprecedented missing persons case. Lina’s subconscious hides many secrets, critical to unraveling the dark case.

Restore Broken Memories and Uncover the Past

Every memory you investigate is missing a key detail. Anything could be the solution. Fill out the correct detail to reveal more of the past.

Challenging and satisfying deduction

Every solution is logical, but not obvious. You’ll need the right clues to deduce the truth. Listen to private conversations. Inspect small details. Slow down and engage your mind to make the right connections.

A Heartbreaking Love Story

A couple deeply in love have both broken down. Lina is losing her memories and Sebastian has gone missing. A disturbing party seems to cover up something else. And a dark tragedy is buried deep in Lina’s mind—in the part named Guilt.

Beautifully Executed

  • Fully voice acted.
  • Unique 3D-scan style.
  • Award-winning story and puzzle design.
